definition: referendum/abbr. for 公民投票[gong1 min2 tou2 piao4]

public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)
to cast/to send/to throw oneself (into the river etc)/to seek refuge/to place oneself into the hands of

sentences.english: The referendum lock installed by the coalition is real;
sentences.chinese: 公投保險鎖真真正正的被聯合政府裝了上去。

sentences.english: According to Annan, that is part of what made this vote so special.
sentences.chinese: 安南說，這也是爲什麼這次公投如此特別的原因之一。

sentences.english: She has said she believes Trump's win and the Brexit vote have helped her campaign.
sentences.chinese: 她說她相信川普的勝選和退歐公投幫助了她的競選。

sentences.english: They want these two demands put to a plebiscite.
sentences.chinese: 他們希望對這兩項要求進行公投。

sentences.english: The citizens of Massachusetts voted yes in a referendum to cut property tax.
sentences.chinese: 麻塞諸賽州市民公投贊成減少財產稅的徵收。

sentences.english: They condemned the referendum law as a tool for separatists.
sentences.chinese: 他們譴責公投只是獨派的工具。

sentences.english: 'The referendum call is basically dead, ' said one senior Socialist party official.
sentences.chinese: 社會黨一位高級官員說，全民公投提案基本沒戲了。

sentences.english: The government is hell-bent on keeping voters away from anything that looks like a referendum.
sentences.chinese: 政府竭力使選民遠離類似公投性質的投票。

sentences.english: Under Greek law, Parliament must approve a proposal for a referendum.
sentences.chinese: 根據希臘法律，全民公投提案必須獲得議會批准。

sentences.english: But the president’s referendum idea is equally cock-eyed.
sentences.chinese: 然而，總統先生關於公投的主意同樣不合時宜。

sentences.english: The referendum seemed almost a foregone conclusion in February, when Mr.
sentences.chinese: 全民公投似乎是預料中必然的結果。

sentences.english: Sunday's result paves the way for the prosecution of the generals responsible.
sentences.chinese: 此次公投結果爲起訴軍方責任人奠定了基礎。

definition: to withdraw from the European Union/abbr. for 脫離歐盟|脱离欧盟
public decision (by ballot)/majority decision/a joint decision/referendum
DPP (Democratic Progressive Party, Taiwan)/abbr. for 民主進步黨|民主进步党
